objects.name: Analytic 0571
objects.description: Detection correlates anomalous Docker or Kubernetes API requests with access to logs, secrets, or service accounts. Observes unauthorized use of `docker logs`, `kubectl get secrets`, or direct API calls to Kubernetes API server endpoints. Identifies behavioral patterns where adversaries escalate from basic pod/container interaction to privileged API calls exposing sensitive credential material.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: docker:api
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: docker logs access or container inspect commands from non-administrative users

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: kubernetes:apiserver
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: exec into pod followed by secret retrieval via API

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: kubernetes:orchestrator
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Access to orchestrator logs containing credentials (Docker/Kubernetes logs)

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: Tune to exclude known orchestrator admin service accounts or CI/CD pipelines that legitimately access secrets
Restrict detection to sensitive namespaces (e.g., kube-system, production apps)
Adjust correlation timing between pod execution and subsequent API secret retrieval
Filter based on allowed internal API calls vs anomalous external or cross-cluster access
